Engine::Timer

Timer Class Reference

#include <util_timer.h>

List of all members.

bool hasReached (double target)

Detailed Description

Class for handling timing of events, and other stuff that needs timing. It is initialized starting at 0 seconds.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Timer (  ) 

Constructor. It initializes the timer, setting the clock to zero. The Timer is initially stopped.

Member Function Documentation

void update (  ) 

Updates the timer. Basically it adds the time passed since the last update, to the clock. It should be called regularily (for instance every time the game loop loops) to keep it updated.

void start (  ) 

Starts the timer. It does not reset it, nor does it change the value of the current time if called when the clock is not 0.

void reset (  ) 

Resets the timer to zero. It does not, however, stop the clock.

void stop (  ) 

Stop the timer.

void setTime ( double  newtime  ) 

Sets the timer to a specified value, in seconds.

double getTime (  ) 

Get the current time.

bool hasReached ( double  target  ) 

Checks if the timer has reached a specified point.

Parameters:
target The target time, in seconds.
Note:
The timer clock does not need to be exactly the target time for this function to interpret it as reached.
Returns:
true if the specified target time has been reached, and false otherwise.
